I validated on a Windows Server 2012 machine, the maven modification and the groovy script is working: 
`[INFO] --- groovy-maven-plugin:2.0:execute (find-supported-python-for-compile) @ beam-sdks-python ---
[INFO] Using python interpreter binary 'python' with pip 'pip2'
[INFO] `

I need to mention though, that my results are somewhat strange: 
pip2 was found even though I have pip2.7 in my path. 
For some the execution of pip2.7 is unsuccessful.

> c:\dev\beam\sdks\python>echo %PATH%
> C:\Windows\system32;C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32\Wbem;C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\;C:\Program Files\Git\cmd;C:\Program Files\Microsoft Windows Performance Toolkit\;C:\Program Files (x86)\CMake\bin;c:\dev\apache-maven-3.3.9\bin;c:\dev\protobuf-2.5.0\;c:\Progra~1\Git\usr\bin;C:\dev\apache-ant-1.7.1\bin;C:\hdp\hadoop-dist\target\hadoop-2.7.1-SNAPSHOT\bin;C:\Python27\;C:\Python27\scripts
>
> c:\dev\beam\sdks\python>pip2.7 --version
> pip 9.0.1 from c:\python27\lib\site-packages (python 2.7)
> 
> c:\dev\beam\sdks\python>\dev\groovy-2.4.10\bin\groovysh
> Groovy Shell (2.4.10, JVM: 1.7.0_79)
> Type ':help' or ':h' for help.
> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> groovy:000> def foo = "pip2.7 --version".execute()
> ERROR java.io.IOException:
> Cannot run program "pip2.7": CreateProcess error=2, The system cannot find the file specified
> groovy:000> def bar = "pip2 --version".execute()
> ===> java.lang.ProcessImpl@22fe404a
> groovy:000>


As I do have the same problem with tox, I don't think it is related to the PR:
`
[INFO] --- exec-maven-plugin:1.5.0:exec (setuptools-test) @ beam-sdks-python ---
[ERROR] Command execution failed.
java.io.IOException: Cannot run program "c:\dev\beam\sdks\python\target\python\bin\tox" (in directory "c:\dev\beam\sdks\python"): CreateProcess error=2, The system cannot find the file specified
	at java.lang.ProcessBuilder.start(ProcessBuilder.java:1047)
	at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:617)
`

R: @amitsela

@staslev Looks like Jenkins is back to normal, ROS tests pass now.
@bjchambers moved all metrics related tests added in this PR to `MetricsTest` as requested.
@tibkiss I do not fully understand the issue. Do you know what is causing it? `tox` should have any `java` errors in it, so I am a bit confused about that part as well.

@aaltay : Sorry for not being clear at the first place.

The problem / weirdness in my system is that java apps (including groovy scripts) are not always able to start executables present on the path. 
In particular: I have both pip2.7 and pip2 in my path, I can start both from a cmd.exe from any directory, but from groovy only pip2 is found.

Taking a second look on Tox's problem I realized that it is a different issue:
The build script tries to execute Tox from 'target\python\bin\tox', but in my system it is located under 'target\python\Scripts\tox'. Sorry about the confusion here.

I believe this problem is unrelated to the change I made in my PR as 'master' branch behaves exactly the same. 

Feel free to ping me in slack if you have further questions. Thanks!
